Introductions

An Overview for this Workshop

About Me (Again)

Hi. 👋 … my name is Joe Versoza.

  • I’m a clinical assistant professor at NYU’s Computer Science Department
  • I haven’t worked with data or databases 😯

About Me (Continued)

jk! … just not recently, and maybe with data different from what you’re working with

  • in a past life, I worked with tons of health insurance data 😴
  • and a small non-profit site with hundreds of thousands of users 👥👥👥👥
  • which meant data in so many formats 🗄️
  • and lots of bad data 😡
    • both from users’ input and…
    • from other companies providing regular data feeds)

About You

Ok… so a little about you:

  • your project involves data in some way or you’re interested in working with data
    • data collection
    • data visualization
    • analysis
  • you haven’t already taken Professor Deena Engel’s database course
    • if you have, feel free to skip this workshop
    • (you’re also welcome to stay for a refresher on that material)

Material

Today, we’ll cover:

  1. Kinds of data; data formats; scrubbing data ✨
  2. Tables: spreadsheets vs. databases
  3. Databases: Working with datasets on the desktop and on servers 🖥️
    • Introduction to Relational Databases
    • Introduction to NoSQL
  4. Data Visualization 📊
  5. Resources

About this Material

This workshop is usually given by Professor Deena Engel, but…

  • we’re transitioning to me being the primary contact for technical support in June / July 🌞💻
  • Deena’s out today! 🤒

The majority of the material on these slides is sourced from a presentation that Deena has given for previous incarnations of this program.
